subject: Re: FW: Threat Intel Notification – New Balada Injector campaign infects 6,700 WordPress sites – Action Required
preview: Hi Eric,  I have added commentary against each of the below migration steps for you.  Please let me know if you have any further questions. Additionally, for your peace of mind, we are in the proces

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia marked as Closed
Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body:
Hi Eric,

I have added commentary against each of the below migration steps for you.

Please let me know if you have any further questions. Additionally, for
your peace of mind, we are in the process of upgrading our security
processes (above industry standards) and we will be officially SOC2
certified in the first half of the year. We will be able to share our SOC2
report with you in due course.

*Mitigation Steps*

   - Do not use the plugin "Popup Builder" if you do not currently use it.
   If you have it installed, please remove it and use an alternative more
   reliable plugin. Please inform us if that is the case so we can advise
   further.

***Noted and not in use.

   - Make sure all your website software, including web server hosts,
   plugins & themes on all your different WordPress sites are regularly
   updated to the latest versions. Automatic updates is an option if you have
   many sites to manage.

***Yes, this is part of our standard practice and included under your
website care plans

   - Conducting regular cleans of software by removing plugins, themes etc.
   that are no longer being used.

***Yes, this is part of our standard practice and included under your
website care plans

   - Activate Multi-Factor Authentication on your WordPress sites and use a
   strong unique complex password. Do not share login details with anyone.
   ***MFA is being rolled out in stages as guided/directed by Nicole
   - Limiting number of site administrators and their permissions. Creating
   privileged accounts should generate alerts to appropriate teams.
   ***Yes, this is part of our standard practice and included under your
   website care plans
   - Keeping local development environment files separate from server files.
   ***Yes, this is part of our standard practice and included under your
   website care plans
   - Implementing file integrity control systems in case of compromise and
   changing database passwords after compromise.
   ***Yes, this is part of our standard practice and included under your
   website care plans
   - Conduct internal and routine penetration testing or similar
   assessments against web applications to identify exploitable weaknesses
   before Balada does.
   ***Yes, this is part of our standard practice and included under your
   website care plans
   - Heavily restrict access to sensitive files like wp-config, website
   backup data, log files or database archives and ensure strong data
   retention policies purge older versions of this data when no longer needed.
   ***Yes, we have the files locked down for edits or deletions
   - Disable unnecessary or insecure server services and protocols like FTP.
   ***We only have SSH and SFTP, so all good.



Thanks and speak soon,
